alert.note: Alert for Mountains Southwestern Shasta County to Western Colusa County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 02 at 12:47PM PST until January 02 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING ABOVE 2000 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING ABOVE 5000 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches above 2000 ft, 3 to 7 inches above 5000 ft. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy wet snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 24 inches above 5000 ft, 24 to 36 inches above 6500 feet. * WHERE...Mountains Southwestern Shasta County to Western Colusa County County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 10 PM PST this evening. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Wednesday morning through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Mountains Southwestern Shasta County to Western Colusa County
